tournament.name: GP Trial - Grand Prix Porto Alegre 2017

decks.notes: The main concept of this deck revolves around creating an infinite combo by using Saheeli Rai's -2 ability to copy Felidar Guardian, which in turn blinks Saheeli Rai and allows you to create an endless loop of hasty 1/4 creatures. This combo creates an overwhelming board presence and can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a large number of creatures. The deck also includes various supporting cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Whirler Virtuoso to provide additional value and control options. Overall, the deck aims to assemble the combo and control the game until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this deck is to apply aggressive pressure on the opponent using a combination of creatures and tempo control spells. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Spell Queller provide strong threats on the board, while cards like Stasis Snare and Metallic Rebuke keep the opponent's board in check. With a mix of counterspells and removal, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while continually applying pressure with evasive creatures. The inclusion of cards like Westvale Abbey and Thalia, Heretic Cathar also add extra versatility and disruption to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful combo by using Saheeli Rai's ability to copy Felidar Guardian, allowing you to repeatedly blink it and generate infinite hasty cat tokens. The deck also includes cards like Rogue Refiner and Chandra, Torch of Defiance for card advantage and tempo. The mana base is designed to provide the correct colors for casting the combo pieces efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo as quickly as possible while controlling the board and generating value from its other cards.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures like Bristling Hydra and Voltaic Brawler, supported by energy-generating cards such as Servant of the Conduit and Attune with Aether. The strategy involves buffing up creatures with pump spells like Larger Than Life and Invigorated Rampage to deal massive damage to the opponent. The inclusion of removal spells like Harnessed Lightning helps to maintain board control while pushing for a fast and aggressive playstyle. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and combat tricks.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game by using a combination of removal spells, efficient creatures, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Fatal Push, Unlicensed Disintegration, and Grasp of Darkness, while also generating card advantage through cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Tireless Tracker. Goblin Dark-Dwellers allows the player to reuse key spells from the graveyard, providing additional value. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Walking Ballista and Traverse the Ulvenwald to adapt to various situations.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and utilizing efficient removal spells to clear the way for attacks. The key strategy is to quickly establish a strong board presence with fast creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Thraben Inspector, while also leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar for additional threats. The inclusion of vehicles like Heart of Kiran and Aethersphere Harvester, alongside supporting cards like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration, allows for versatile and aggressive gameplay to consistently apply pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Scrapheap Scrounger alongside strong planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration to clear the way for your creatures to attack. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive strategy, with a mix of fast lands, color-fixing lands, and utility lands. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing efficient creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Scrapheap Scrounger, backed up by powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. The combination of artifact synergy with cards like Heart of Kiran and Unlicensed Disintegration provides both offense and removal options. The inclusion of Aethersphere Harvester and Veteran Motorist adds additional versatility to the deck. The main objective is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mixture of creature-based threats and efficient removal spells, ultimately leading to a fast-paced victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By incorporating a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Chandra, Torch of Defiance, alongside efficient creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Thraben Inspector, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control. The inclusion of cards like Scrounge and Unlicensed Disintegration provide additional removal options, while Heart of Kiran serves as a versatile threat. Overall, the goal of this Mardu Aggro deck is to establish dominance and finish the game swiftly.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. Utilizing powerful threats like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn, alongside versatile cards like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration, the deck aims to maintain continuous pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan. The inclusion of Heart of Kiran and Walking Ballista provides additional versatility and reach, allowing the deck to adapt to different threats and strategies. By combining efficient threats with strong removal options, the deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and secure a swift victory.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively control the board with early threats like Toolcraft Exemplar and Scrapheap Scrounger, backed up by efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration. This deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and creatures like Thalia, Heretic Cathar to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of vehicles like Heart of Kiran and Aethersphere Harvester further enhances the deck's ability to close out games quickly by delivering hasty, damage-dealing threats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize energy-generating cards like Servant of the Conduit, Rogue Refiner, and Whirler Virtuoso to power up Aetherworks Marvel. By using Marvel to cheat out high-cost Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes some removal spells like Harnessed Lightning and Shock to control the board while generating energy. Additionally, there are some utility cards like Tireless Tracker and Nissa's Renewal for card advantage and ramp. The deck's strategy revolves around efficiently generating and using energy to ramp into game-winning threats.
